intro: Eremostachys transjordanica, commonly known as the Jordanian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, adapting to extreme drought conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are often clustered in cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Eremostachys transjordanica is well-suited to harsh environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
